member.name: WS_REQUEST_SECURITY_TOKEN_PROPERTY_CONSTRAINT
member.summary: This structure is used to specify a set of constraints for a particular request security token property. Any property constraints that are not specified will use the default constraints.

summary.para: The id of the request security token property. The following security property constraint may be specified:

item.description:
This property indicates which WS-Trust versions are acceptable.
If this property is not specified, then the default constraint value of will be used.
Currently only is supported in policy, so a property constraint containing the value WS_TRUST_VERSION_FEBRUARY_2005 must be specified in order for the policy to match.

member.name: WS_REQUEST_SECURITY_TOKEN_PROPERTY_CONSTRAINT.allowedValues
member.summary: An array of values which are acceptable. The type of the values in the array correspond to the type of the values of the request security token property. See the documentation for a particular request security token property to determine the type of the property.

member.name: WS_REQUEST_SECURITY_TOKEN_PROPERTY_CONSTRAINT.allowedValuesSize
member.summary: The total size of the allowedValues array, in bytes. This size must be a multiple of the size of the type of the value of the property.

member.name: WS_REQUEST_SECURITY_TOKEN_PROPERTY_CONSTRAINT.out
member.summary: When returns NOERROR, the entire contents of this structure will be filled out.
